original_title: Sri Lanka sells extra Rs7bn Treasury bonds after auction
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has sold 7,000 million rupees of bonds offered on tap at the average rates set at an auction last week, bringing the total of bonds sold in the week to 123.16 billion, data from the central bank’s Public Debt Department showed.
The debt office sold a 01 October 2032 maturity bond (LKB02032J017) at a weighted average yield rate of 10.45 percent.
The debt office sold a 15 June 2035 maturity bond (LKB01035F159) at a weighted average yield rate of 10.96 percent.
On Thursday, 116.16 billion rupees in 2030, 2032, and 2035 bonds were sold.
